speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Suppose you didn't understand what was said. How would you ask something like "how's that?" or "what?"

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez des dollars?
narrator_cue: Ask someone if he has some dollars.

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez du vin?
narrator_cue: Ask him if he has some wine.

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: How does he tell you he has no wine?

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Say, "Well then, give me one franc."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Mais la bière est pour Georges.
narrator_cue: Say, "But the beer is for Georges."

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Here is how to say, "You can."

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous pouvez manger maintenant?

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Tell him you don't want to.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez du vin?
narrator_cue: Ask the young woman if she has some wine.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez de la bière?
narrator_cue: Ask her if she has any beer.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez des dollars?
narrator_cue: Ask her if she has any dollars.

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: How does she say, "I have many"?

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Suppose she doesn't have any, what would she say?

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: How would she say she doesn't have many?

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Now, try to say, "I want some."

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Now, try to say, "You want some."

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: And now just say, "I haven't any."

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Look at number four. The word in the middle, E-T, is also pronounced "É."
